Guys anyone who has the CRYSIS logo pop up and then the game doesnt start.... this is how you fix it!

1 - Start the game, it crashes yes.. ok now go into ur C: Program Data folder and you will now see an Electronic Arts folder inside... DELETE it completely.

2 - Go into control panel and into "System"

3 - Go to "Computer" tab where you can change your name and description... CHANGE BOTH names! the name of the computer and then the Description to anything... (ex:) "fuckdapolice"

4 - Restart the computer

5 - Now start the game again it will crash again recreating the Electronic Arts folder once more... now delete the EA folder again one more time and Boot up Crysis 3

Game crashes at the start of new game because there is no profile selected. Profile creator does not allow a profile to be created, says there is an error and a new name should be used regardless of what name is used. Anyone else?

@Funkyasshit: Your display should have an option for how to handle lower resolutions in its setup menu. The naming differs widely between manufacturers. Look for something like "scaling". On my Dell it's called "Wide Mode". You should set that to "Fill" or "Aspect" or whatever it is called with yours. Check your monitor's manual.

Graphics drivers may also offer controls for this. Eg. in the Radeon's AMD Vision Control Centre under "My Digital Flat-Panels" -> "Properties" there is an option called "Image Scaling".

Ok for all who want to play the game make sure that your card is DX11 compatible, which means NVIDIA GTS 450 / AMD HD 5770 or higher.
The Nvidia GTS 250 (which is basically the same card with GTS 450) does not supports dx11. There is no software patch that will make your card dx11 compatible, its hardware, dont trust any weird sites telling about patches or simulators etc... u may destroy your cards. If u really want to play this game, unfortunatly u will have to spend at least 100 euro for a dx11 card (make sure it has more than 1gb memory. i hope I helped.
